intro: Laetia scabra, commonly known as the rough laetia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Laetia scabra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in arid environments.
